subject: Olympic Games
Steroids
lead_paragraph: The International Association of Athletics Federations will meet today to discuss Marion Jones’s doping case, including whether to erase her Olympic and world championship results.Jones retired in October after acknowledging that she took a designer steroid from September 2000 to July 2001. She won gold medals in the 100- and 200-meter dashes and in 1,600 relay in the 2000 Sydney Olympics, as well as bronzes in the 400 relay and the long jump.Jones has returned her Olympic medals and agreed to forfeit all results dating to Sept. 1, 2000, but the I.A.A.F. and International Olympic Committee must still change the record books. The I.A.A.F. president, Lamine Diack, has called Jones “one of the biggest frauds in sporting history.”.
